text:
The node_modules folder will only appear if you’ve installed node packages locally (not using the `-g` flag) to that project. If you haven’t installed any project-specific node resources, you shouldn’t expect a node_modules folder. :)

For example, you shouldn’t expect to see anything show up in your project file when you run `npm install -g @HubSpot/cli`, since that’s installing the CLI globally.

If you don’t seem to be running into any problems, you’re probably fine to carry on for now! However, I would pretty strongly recommend looking into other learning resources that can help to familiarize you with Node and NPM — they’re hugely important fixtures in the landscape of modern web development, and this definitely won’t be the only time you run into them as you learn.

Good luck with your cert! :)

Thank you! First I installed it also without `-g` flag and node-modules folder wasn’t there either, but perhaps since I already have node modules installed globally from before, they won’t appear in my HubSpot project anyway?
